# NSWindowTab

**Class**

A tab associated with a window that is part of a tabbing group.

## Declaration

```swift
class NSWindowTab
```

## Overview

[doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindowTab] describes the way a window displays as part of a tabbed window group. The properties of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindowTab] are configurable at any time, but only take effect when the associated [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow] displays in a tab.

AppKit automatically creates an instance of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindowTab] for each [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow]. You can access a window’s tab object using the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/tab] property.

## Customizing the Title

- **title**: The title for the window tab.
- **attributedTitle**: The title for the window tab, specified as an attributed string.

## Customizing the Tooltip

- **toolTip**: The tooltip for this window tab.

## Adding an Accessory View

- **accessoryView**: An optional accessory view for the tab.

## Related Documentation

- **tabbingIdentifier**: A value that allows a group of related windows.

## Windows

- **NSWindow**: A window that an app displays on the screen.
- **NSPanel**: A special kind of window that typically performs a function that is auxiliary to the main window.
- **NSWindowDelegate**: A set of optional methods that a window’s delegate can implement to respond to events, such as window resizing, moving, exposing, and minimizing.
- **NSWindowTabGroup**: A group of windows that display together as a single tabbed window.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
